reviewText: I rented this on Amazon Instant video based on the 4 star rating most reviewers seem to give this film. Oh my God! Awesome! Zak Kilberg is gorgeous in this movie! He really, really knows how to act. The movie is great because there aren't a heck of a lot of characters. It's mostly about Jacob and what he has to go through to realize that whoops, yes he IS a vampire. The dialogue is sparse but powerful. The film is shot very professionally. I was afarid it was going to be a low-budget deal but it sooo wasn't! Squee! I just love discovering new gems!Wonderful though, and very different from the run of the mill vampire junk out there. Warning, spoilers ahead. Jacob is a night security guard and an artist. He hooks up with a club-kid-type woman named Mary who struggles with an addiction of her own while trying to help Jacob out during his misery of not knowing what is wrong with him.It's a story of Jacob discovering his true nature and his true place in the world.Mary sees something in him and in his art and helps him get recognition for his paintings.Unfortuantely some bad stuff happens the deeper Jacob and Mary go into vampire-land. The LAPD's on Jacob's tail, he has a gangsta-type guy selling him expired blood packets from a hospital who gets meaner and meaner as the movie goes on. Jacob wrestles with his own conscience.Excellent ending too that I won't spoil here. If you don't believe the reviews, rent the film for 3 bucks. It is more than worth it. I just purchased the DVD right after watching the rental I liked it that much! I've seen a LOT of vampire movies so it takes quite a story to make a good impression on me. I'm extremely critical of vampire films because there is so much trash out there, but this one sent shivers up my spine and left me with a smile on my face wanting more.Only drawback to the film...never mentions how Jacob got "infected" with the vampire-like disease. Shows a pic of him as a young boy with a bandage on his arm from a burn from the sun so we assume he's always been this way. I'd kind of like to see a sequel just to have a little more background about this character. Not enough to dim the light on this beautiful movie though! GO! Watch it now!

reviewText: If you enjoy vampire movies and am tired of the same old same old, then this is a must see DVD. Its slow paced but not boring. Bloody but not gorey. Its definately not a gorefest and its definately not twilight, not a chick flick. Its about how a regular person like you and me deals with an illness he doesnt understand. Watch this movie as soon as you can.

reviewText: Not since George Romero's MARTIN has there been a vampire film quite like this one! MIDNIGHT SON tells the tale of Jacob, a lonely security guard whose nocturnal existence is turned upside down when he meets the girl of his dreams. The only thing standing in the way of true love is the insatiable bloodlust that consumes him. Scott Leberecht's breakthrough feature Horror film is an Indie sensation, a bold new take on the vampire film that proves, once again, that story and character win out over big-budget effects. Jacob, like the audience, is unsure of the nature of his existence, despite a number of telling signs that lead us to believe he is a vampire. It requires much convincing before anyone will know the truth, but no one is more shocked at the outcome than our troubled protagonist. Leberecht's subtle script leaves plenty to the imagination, dropping ambiguous clues that leave us guessing until the very end. The character of Jacob is brought to life through Zak Kilberg's understated performance, which becomes increasingly more powerful as he continues to draw from the audiences' sympathies. The glamour of the Hollywood vampire has been stripped away to reveal the loneliness and despair of living such a solitary existence. Maya Parish mixes it up by adding an element of excitement and chaos into Jacob's life as Mary in another great performance. In the decades to come, MIDNIGHT SON will be found standing beside films like MARTIN, BLOOD MOON, and LET'S SCARE JESSICA TO DEATH for the high levels of originality, effectiveness, and atmosphere that have been achieved on such a low budget.-Carl ManesI Like Horror Movies

reviewText: This is a terrific film. Low budget and done right. Very little special effects needed. Better than most Hollywood Blockbusters. Loved it! If you are looking for a good horror film with substance or are looking for a new vampire movie, you must check out this movie.

reviewText: Darn it I loved this movie. I've been thinking about it for days since seeing it. It's one of those films that lingers on the brain long after it's been viewed.The acting is superb and there is such amazing attention to detail. The script is truly clever and, although a slow burn of a movie, watching it smolder and build to a bonfire is truly engrossing.As others have said, this isn't so much a horror film in a traditional sense; it is more psychological horror intertwined with romance and a quite well executed one at that.There was one lingering question that I still scratch my head at a bit and wish had been clarified, though:<VER TINY SPOILER FOLLOWS!>I'm confused about the dude who played the Caprisun drink in the car... I thought he was earlier dead and drained on the table so wasn't quite clear on how they were getting more "juice" out of him in the car ride.<END SPOILER>In the end, it's just a smart vampire flick for folks who like their vampire flicks smart, and the taste of it will linger on the lips and palette long after you've digested it. ;)
summary: Smart Vampire Flick for Folks who Like it That Way

reviewText: I know, I know, you're tired of the vampire films and books. I've never really taken an interest into either, but I heard good things about this one in particular and was pleasantly surprised.Let's do the negative first. Some parts of the movie seem forced artistically and their attempt to weave romantic struggles into the plot is sometimes poorly executed. Moreover, the movie rushes some of the most important conflicts and prematurely arrives at the credits.Despite these shortcomings, the movie is a fairly original and mostly enjoyable movie. It's certainly worth a watch if you're into the indie-supernatural genre. If they would have invested a bit more in the details, I think it could have been truly wonderful.If you're into broken women, you'll love Maya Parish's character.

reviewText: MIDNIGHT SON is an intriguing and innovative spin on the vampire genre.  Zack Kilberg is quite effective as Jacob, an introverted young security guard, besieged with a bizarre medical condition.  He is unable to tolerate direct sunlight, a condition that eventually leads him to crave and require human blood.  Maya Parish is convincing as the coke-snorting street vendor he becomes enamored with and whose bloody nose triggers his bloodlust.The movie serves as both a unique horror tale and a warning about addiction.MIDNIGHT SON leaves some unanswered questions and the editing is often choppy.  But it creates some eerie atmospheric tension and works well as a low-budget indie.
summary: DARK EFFECTIVE TALE IS QUITE DIFFERENT

reviewText: Don't know if this movie came out in theatre but it should have. This is how a vampire movie should be done. Vampire movies always turn out into a romantic soap opera instead of a horror movie. I'm not saying this is the scariest vampire movie, but it's how it would be if it took place in 2012. This makes the list of my top 20 vampire movies. I saw it by myself. I liked it so much invited a friend and saw it together. This is the type of movie they would show on Sci Fi channel during the month of October in celebration of Halloween. Enjoy the movie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: In its quiet, unobtrusive way, "Midnight Son" is actually one of the better vampire flicks I've ever seen. It's rather deliberately paced, but patient viewers will be rewarded with an intelligent, poignant story that stirs plenty of dread while showing its teeth in more than a couple cringe-inducing moments. Here again we have a lead character who's filled with angst and misgivings about his "condition" -- but in this case, he initially believes he simply has a rare skin disorder that makes him ultra-sensitive to sunlight. As his plight worsens and his cravings for blood become more frequent and violent, the film introduces a number of interesting characters and grisly situations that ratchet up the sympathy and suspense in equal measure. Zak Kilberg turns in an enjoyably solid, believable and low-key performance as lead character Jacob; and Maya Parish (who bears at least a passing resemblance to dearly-departed Sarah Wayne Callies of "The Walking Dead") is the dark beauty who flirts with the idea of becoming his love interest. Well worth a viewing, or even two.
summary: Smart, Stylish Indie Film -- Way Better Than Expected

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: The film is a modern take on the vampire theme minus the supernatural and magical elements. Twenty-four year old Jacob (Zak Kilberg) is a recluse who paints and works nights as mall security. He meets Mary (Maya Parish) who likes the nose candy and has her own issues. Through a series of events Jacob discovers he likes blood, human blood like a fat kid likes cake.He develops cravings which gets him into the expected mess as one might guess when someone craves human blood. You don't see everything that happens. This is to create the feeling of Jacob's black outs and the production's budgetary concerns. Such is art.The movie ends at the point it would start to make an interesting film such as "Psychos in Love" which I liked better.Parental Guide: F-bomb, sex, nudity (Maya Parish)
summary: MAYBE WE SHOULD JUST BE FRIENDS
